ast.name: Quick Math
ast.comment:
This app intends to help kids (basically aged from 3 to 7 years old) to learn basic arithmetic in a simpler and quicker way.

The idea of this app is basically from the memory when I was a kid learning basic arithmetic. Even addition and subtraction within 10 took me many days to get familiar with. At that time, I did plenty of practice exercises. Therefore,  I am trying to develop this app that can generate random basic arithmetic questions for kids. I hope them can have fun learning basic arithmetic.

When I was trying to develop this app, I found an app- LetterDefender ,designed by Russel Beattie (script unique code:/zkre), which can present my idea very well, so I used some lines of code in LetterDefender.

Currently, what the app can do(not in a perfect way, but generally illustrates the idea)?
1. Three random questions will fall down from the top of the screen, and you can tap the numbers on the screen and press "send" to answer question, if you enter the wrong answer by mistake, you can press clear and re-enter your answer.
2. You will be given three lives. If there is a question go below the red line, you will lose a life.
3. You will get 10 points for answering a question right, and the speed of the falling question will increase each time when you get a 100-point.
4. When the game ended, you will be given a chance to re-start the game.

Features to be added later on:
- Choosing question category, it includes: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
- Choosing the degree of the difficulty.
- Tutorial session. Help kids learn some tricks when doing math.

Features may be implemented:
-Ranking list. Compare your score with other players.
-Online battle. Real time battle among kids through network.

body.text: There will be more features added  in the final app. For example, category choosing, setting the degree of difficulty, tutorial session and maybe some socializing elements,etc.
